inventory.commentary: 12Jan08 update to wn2.1, add features, examples, commentary ahouston

sense.name: the acquisition of something with money
sense.commentary: PURCHASE[+event][+contractual][+acquisition][+with_money] the acquisition of something for payment Note: a nominalization: X's purchase of Y -> X purchased Y
sense.examples: They have a large selection of videos available for purchase. (X purchase them) The purchase of that large tract of North America was made during the Napoleonic Wars. The courts may rule that purchase of the smaller company by the larger is monopolistic.

sense.name: thing bought
sense.examples: She came home from the store and showed me her purchases. We stowed our purchases in the car before going on to lunch. Bob took his purchase to the gift wrapping department.

sense.name: gaining control or influence in a context
sense.commentary: PURCHASE[+state][+physical][+influence][+control] a means of exerting influence or gaining advantage
sense.examples: The horses' hooves fought for purchase on the slippery pavement. He could get no purchase on the situation. As the car skidded, she clutched the steering wheel for more purchase.

sense.name: mechanical leverage
sense.commentary: PURCHASE[+state][+physical][+leverage][+mechanical] the mechanical advantage gained by being in a position to use a lever
sense.examples: The purchase allowed him to lift the safe.
